title: ['Cave Mountain Road Temporary Closure', 'South Woolum Road Closed, Alternate Route Available', 'Spring Creek Landing Closed to Vehicle-Assisted Launches']
description: ['Newton County Road 5, also known as Cave Mountain Road, will be closed Mondays - Thursdays from 8am - 4pm for road improvements. The road will be open Fridays - Sundays to all traffic.', 'In the interest of safety, the South Woolum Road has been closed. The Woolum launch and campground remain open.', 'The Spring Creek Landing has been closed to vehicle-assisted launches. Watercraft may still be put in and take out at this point, but must be hand carried to and from the parking area. This is to ensure the safety of visitors and avoid continued erosion.']

title: ['West and East Border Roads closed for public safety', 'Gachado Line Camp open. Southeast border road and access roads closed', 'Pozo Nuevo Road to Bates Well Ranch High Clearance, 4-Wheel Drive Only']
description: ['The border roads remain closed (the dirt roads directly along the border and all crossover roads leading from South Puerto Blanco Drive to the border) to all public vehicle and pedestrian traffic for public safety. South Puerto Blanco Drive remains open.', 'El Camino De Dos Republicas remains open from SR85 to Gachado Line Camp. Dos Lomitas is not accessible. The southeast border road from Lukeville Port of Entry eastward to the Santa Rosa Mountains is closed to public vehicle and pedestrian traffic.', 'High Clearance, 4-wheel drive is required from where Pozo Nuevo Road begins along South Puerto Blanch Drive to Bates Well Ranch area. The road is washed out in areas. Bates Well Ranch is still accessible from the north on Darby Well Road.']

title: ['Road Construction Projects']
description: ['Parkway areas closed for ongoing road maintenance and construction projects.']

park: Katahdin Woods and Waters National Monument
title: ['Seboeis Road Closed Due to Washout', 'Loop Road and North Entrance Seasonal Closures']
description: ['The Seboeis Road is closed from the junction with Swift Brook Road to the park boundary line just south of the privately owned cabin along the East Branch Penobscot River. The road will be repaired once conditions permit heavy equipment to enter the area.', 'The Loop Road and North Entrance are closed to motorized vehicles until May 23, 2025. These areas are accessible by foot and bicycle. Restrooms and campsites are accessible but not maintained in the off-season. Learn more below.']
relatedRoadEvents: [[{'title': 'Seboeis Road Closed Due to Washout', 'id': '427BB9B5-50FA-4144-B479-C3824CA24587', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/kaww/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'Seasonal Road Closures ', 'id': '5FB538D1-9B40-4FD9-AFE9-F63EA553C3FF', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/kaww/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]]

title: ['Straight Fork and Heintooga Roads Closed', 'Sparks Lane and Hyatt Lane are closed', 'Most visitors need a parking tag']
description: ['Straight Fork and Heintooga Ridge and Round Bottom Roads Closed.', 'Closed for visitor and wildlife protection until further notice. Access to the Cades Cove Loop Road remains open from sunrise to sunset each day.', 'All vehicles parking for longer than 15 minutes require a parking tag. Three tag durations are available for purchase for all vehicle sizes and types: Daily ($5), Weekly ($15), or Annual ($40).']
relatedRoadEvents: [[{'title': 'Road Closed', 'id': '59FE3FF5-72D8-4A65-81E6-E6F9D859A721', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/grsm/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'Sparks Lane and Hyatt Lane are closed due to high water', 'id': 'F78F689D-8EE8-4C52-BA05-52FB7F79C2BE', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/grsm/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], []]

title: ['No vehicle access to Fern Canyon from Gold Bluffs Beach']
description: ['Davison Road is closed beyond Gold Bluffs Beach Campground while crews repair the road. To reach Fern Canyon, park before the gate and hike the road to the trailhead. A round-trip hike through Fern Canyon from this point is 3 miles.']
relatedRoadEvents: [[{'title': 'Gold Bluffs Beach to Fern Canyon Vehicle Closure', 'id': '1292A326-85D2-409C-B0D3-D12897F1FBBE', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/redw/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]]

title: ['Pierce Stocking Scenic Drive Winter & Spring Vehicle Road Closure']
description: ['This road is closed to vehicles. It remains open to foot traffic. The entire Lake Michigan Overlook area (Stop #9) is closed including parking lot, all walkways, and overlooks. The drive is expected to open to vehicles May 22.']

title: ['Guadalupe Mountains National Park Moves to “High” Fire Danger Rating', 'Williams Ranch Road Closed', "Devil's Hall is a Strenuous Hike"]
description: ['In addition to park fire regulations: . Smoking limited to inside a vehicle. · No open fires (this includes wood, charcoal and/or gas fire pits) are permitted anywhere in the park. · Use of gas canister stoves for cooking are still allowed at this time', 'The Williams Ranch Road is currently impassable and closed to public access due to unsafe conditions.', "The hike to Devil's Hall is rated as strenuous. The portion of the route in the wash requires rock scrambling and is dangerous when wet or if water is present. The wash surface is loose gravel and rocks and may be unstable."]

title: ['Fort Hunt Loop Road temporarily closed to vehicles']
description: ['The Fort Hunt Loop Road is temporarily closed to vehicles between Picnic Areas B and C due to maintenance work on a water leak. Pedestrians and bicyclists are able to move around the work zone marked with barrels and cones.']
relatedRoadEvents: [[{'title': 'Fort Hunt Loop Road temporarily closed to vehicles', 'id': 'CB432D0F-A09D-4C1E-A483-199F6B3C455E', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/gwmp/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]]

title: ['West Rim Roadwork', 'Please park legally and responsibly in Zion National Park and the Town of Springdale']
description: ['The West Rim Road from Lava Point Campground to the West Rim Trailhead will be closed May 12th to May 21st for road work. Visitors may park at Lava Point Campground to access West Rim trailhead. The campground itself is still closed for the season.', 'Zion has limited parking space. Park only in designated stalls. Vehicles parked outside of designated stalls are subject to citation and may be towed. Once all designated parking stalls in Zion are full, visitors should park in Springdale.']

title: ['Temporary Road Closure', 'River Ferry at Akers (on State Highway K) CLOSED until further notice']
description: ['The Tram Road south of Van Buren will be temporarily closed until maintenance crews can repair a collapsed section near Chilton (approximately 7.8 miles south of Van Buren). Barricades will be placed on each side of the obstruction.', 'The Akers Ferry on State Highway K will not be in service until further notice.']

title: ['Tioga Road (Highway 120 through the park) is closed for the winter']
description: ['Tioga Road (continuation of Highway 120 through the park) is closed for the season due to snow. It usually opens around late May or June. Call 209/372-0200 (then 1, 1) for road conditions.']
relatedRoadEvents: [[{'title': 'Tioga and Glacier Point Road winter closure', 'id': '4814382E-C85E-42D8-B7B4-CEBA7F35A4BA', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/yose/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]]

title: ['North Entrance Road and Most of Rim Drive Remain CLOSED.', 'Roads May Be Icy - Please Use Caution!']
description: ['North Entrance Road, East & most of West Rim Drives remain CLOSED with deep snow. The road from Rim Village to Discovery Point is now open for vehicles. Most roads will not reopen until mid to late June or July 2025. Hwy 62 & Munson Valley Rd are open.', 'Even though the sun is shining, the open roads in the park may still have icy patches, especially in the mornings and evenings when the temperatures drop. Please drive with caution.']
relatedRoadEvents: [[{'title': 'Seasonal Closure of North Entrance Road and Rim Drive', 'id': '60D26BCB-B47D-4B38-8562-EF54ACF41B59', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/crla/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], []]

title: ['Green River Ferry Temporarily Closed']
description: ['The Green River Ferry is temporarily closed due to extensive damage to its navigational system and support towers sustained during flooding in April 2025. The vehicle ferry operation will be closed for several months until repairs are complete.']

park: Santa Monica Mountains National Recreation Area
title: ['Trail Alert: Cheeseboro Canyon Maintenance on Ranch Center Road']
description: ['Cheeseboro Canyon maintenance from March 17 – May 30, 2025, on Ranch Center Rd. will have large vehicles/heavy equipment. Trail closed: Weekdays from 8 AM to 5 PM. Open: Evenings and weekends. Work may be extended to late June if delayed by weather.']

park: Selma to Montgomery National Historic Trail
title: ['Temporary Location - Selma Welcome Center']
description: ['Due to the closure of the Selma Interpretive Center, the Selma Welcome Center at 14 Broad Street has trail staff to provide visitor information services.']

park: Craters of the Moon National Monument and Preserve
title: ['Loop Road OPEN to All Vehicles', 'Navigation']
description: ['The Loop Road is OPEN to vehicles (except the Spur Road to the Caves Area, which remains closed until ice and snow melt enough to allow safe access to Caves.)', 'Please do not rely upon GPS digital navigation systems to find your way to Craters of the Moon. Please note that the Visitor Center at 1266 Craters Loop Road is located just off U.S. Highway 20/26/93 and is not accessed via any unpaved roads.']

title: ['Route 7 from Sawmill, AZ is NOT recommended']
description: ['Entering the park from the east at Sawmill, AZ on Route 7 is not recommended. Part of this route is UNPAVED and UNMAINTAINED. Please stay on paved roads, such as Indian Route 64 from Tsaile, AZ and Highway 191/Route 7 from Chinle, AZ.']

title: ['Drive Cautiously - Endangered Birds on Roadway']
description: ['Nēnē (Hawaiian geese) and ʻuaʻu (Hawaiian petrel) are nesting in the park and may land on or frequent park roads, parking lots, and road leading up to the park. Drivers are reminded to drive at the posted speed limits and exercise caution.']

title: ['Stage II Fire Restrictions']
description: ['Stage II Fire Restrictions will be in effect beginning Tuesday, January 21, 2025. Due to high fire danger, El Morro will implement Stage II Fire Restrictions. These include no campfires. No smoking except in an enclosed vehicle or other authorized area.']

title: ['Closures Due to Flood Damage', 'High Fire Danger']
description: ['Some areas of the park including Walnut Canyon Desert Drive and some trails remain closed after extensive flood damage. The main park road to the visitor center and cavern is open.', 'Due to high fire danger, there are multiple closures and prohibited activities. The main park road to Carlsbad Cavern and the visitor center is open.']

title: ['Most Park Roads Open - Dunraven Pass Still Closed', 'Vehicle entrance reservation not needed', 'Elk With Calves Are Extremely Dangerous']
description: ['All roads are open for the summer season, with the exception of Dunraven Pass (connecting Canyon to Tower-Roosevelt). Roads may still close temporarily due to weather. Check the Park Roads page for the most up-to-date information.', 'Although an entrance pass is required to enter Yellowstone National Park, vehicle reservations are not needed. You are encouraged to purchase an entrance pass before arriving, but you may also purchase passes at any entrance station upon arrival.', 'Be alert, especially this time of year around Mammoth Hot Springs. Elk calves may be hidden close to buildings, under or next to vehicles, and around blind corners. You must remain at least 25 yards from all wildlife. If an elk charges, retreat!']

title: ['Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway continues with additional Parkway closures']
description: ['Beginning Tuesday, April 9, 2024, construction will close the Colonial Parkway to all travel in either direction between Yorktown and VA Route 199. Follow all detour signs. See additional closure information in the link below.']

title: ['Volcano Road Closed to RVs and Buses over 26 feet, and to all Trailers.']
description: ['The Volcano top road is not accessible to RVs, buses, attached trailers, or any other vehicle over 26 feet in length, due to the narrowness and weight limits of Volcano Road. Trailer drop off and RV/bus parking is available at the Visitor Center.']

title: ['Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park']
description: ['You can prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots and scenic overlooks. Before leaving your car for even a short period of time: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.']

title: ['Portions of Braddock Road Trail Closed']
description: ['Portions of the Braddock Road Trail at the Indian Run bridge are closed until a new foot bridge is constructed.']

title: ['Bridge Closure on Sunflower Road']
description: ['Sunflower Road is closed at Big Sandy Creek for bridge replacement. Big Sandy Trail is open and accessible via Sunflower Road from Dallardsville.']

park: Fredericksburg and Spotsylvania County Battlefields Memorial National Military Park
title: ['Road Repair Project Ongoing']
description: ['Through the month of May, park maintenance staff will be working to repair and resurface roads. You may experience delays due to this work while driving in the park.']

title: ['Parking at Boundary Access Areas']
description: ["Visitors are reminded to park in designated parking areas when accessing the park via boundary trailheads. Parking in unauthorized locations may result in your vehicle being towed at the owner's expense."]

title: ['Dunes Drive Safety Corridor', 'Park Closures', 'RV and Tractor Trailer Parking at the Visitor Center']
description: ['Dunes Drive is open. A safety corridor is in effect between mile marker 3 and 5.5 along Dunes Drive. Visitors may drive but not stop or exit their vehicle in this area.', 'From time to time the missile range that surrounds the park performs military testing that may require the closure of the park or Highway 70. Please plan your visit around upcoming military tests.', 'There is limited space for parking for recreational vehicles and trailers in the parking lot directly in front (south) of the visitor center. RVs are asked to not park in the lot behind the visitor center. There is no parking space for tractor trailers.']

title: ['Several Small Roads Closed Due to Roadway Damage Or Snow Accumulation', 'Mineral King Road Is Closed Due To A Regular Seasonal Closure. Expected To Reopen May 21.']
description: ['These roads are closed due to roadway damage during past storm events or due to snow accumulation: Crystal Cave Rd, Middle Fork Rd, Redwood Canyon Rd, South Fork Rd', 'The portion of Mineral King Road inside Sequoia National Park is closed for the winter season to the general public. The road typically reopens in May on the Wednesday before Memorial Day, but could be later depending on conditions.']
relatedRoadEvents: [[{'title': 'Road Closures Related to Past Storm Events and Snow Accumulation', 'id': '667EE370-7B7C-4A64-85CA-051F5C27F309', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/seki/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'Mineral King Road Seasonal Closure', 'id': '5096154A-71A4-4F51-A7F8-98E102608092', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/seki/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]]

title: ['Flooding/bridge out on the Grand Portage Trail at Poplar Creek']
description: ['Increased rain and beaver dam activity flooded the Poplar Creek Crossing along the Grand Portage Trail, washing out the bridge. Please use caution as you pass. Park staff is in the process of determining a route less prone to flood damage.']

title: ['Government Wash closure to vehicle access and overnight camping']
description: ['Government Wash Road and 8.0 Mile Road will be blocked, and motor vehicle access and overnight camping in the area will be prohibited. Hiking, biking, and shoreline access by boat for recreation within 100 feet of the shoreline will remain available.']

title: ['North Union Avenue and Grant Circle Closed for Repairs', 'Adjustments to USS Cairo Museum and Visitor Center Days of Operation', 'National Cemetery Closed to Vehicles; Open to Pedestrians', 'Louisiana Circle Closed']
description: ['North Union Avenue and Grant Circle are closed to vehicular and pedestrian traffic for repairs. Entering these construction areas is prohibited. This work is to repair severe weather damage in 2020. The remainder of the park and tour road are open.', 'Starting October 2, 2024, the USS Cairo Museum will be open 7 days a week and the Visitor Center will be open Wednesday-Sunday. The park grounds, fee booth, Visitor Center restrooms, and tour road will remain open seven days a week.', 'Due to weather related incidents, Vicksburg National Cemetery is closed to vehicular traffic, however it is open to pedestrians. Visitor can park in the adjacent USS Cairo parking lot and walk into the cemetery.', 'Louisiana Circle is closed to vehicles and pedestrians due to slope instability. Navy Circle is open and also provides views of the Mississippi River.']

title: ['Temporary Blackland Prairie Trail Closure to Equestrians']
description: ['Heavy rain has undermined a culvert making it unsafe for passage. Due to horse trailer parking availability, the entire section is closed to equestrians. Hikers are still able to travel from the railroad tracks to the Parkway Visitor Center.']

title: ['Tour Road Closed']
description: ['Due to safety hazards caused by tornado damage the tour road and nature trail are closed. The visitor center is now open.']

title: ['Reds Meadow Road Access Restrictions in 2025', 'Reds Meadow Road and Devils Postpile National Monument are closed for the season']
description: ['Reds Meadow Road and shuttle service, which provide access to Devils Postpile, will only be open Fridays–Sundays (and on Thursdays with one-hour delays in July and August). The road will tentatively open for the season on July 3 and close October 6, 2025.', 'Reds Meadow Road, which provides access to Devils Postpile National Monument, is closed for the season, with a planned reopening on July 3, 2025.']

title: ['Oversized Vehicles are Unable to Park in Visitor Center Parking Lot']
description: ['Due to construction, oversized vehicles will not be allowed to park in the visitor center parking lot due to lack of space and ability to turn-around safely. There is oversized parking along the main park road.']

title: ['Road Open To: Mile 30 (Teklanika River)', 'Park Operations Altered Due to Pretty Rocks Landslide']
description: ['The Denali Park Road is open to Mile 30, Teklanika River. Please stay alert for heavy equipment traveling on the park road.', 'Summer access to facilities and services in Denali remains altered due to the Pretty Rocks Landslide and the associated closure of the Park Road at Mile 43. Check here for more information on what to expect.']

title: ['Miners River Bridge Closed']
description: ['The bridge connecting Miners Castle Road to Miners Beach is closed for a full bridge replacement. Closures will go through spring 2025.']

title: ['The Use of GPS is NOT Recommended']
description: ['Numerous visitors have been routed to remote trailheads and out-of-the-way roads trying to use GPS to reach the main park area or shuttle stop.']

title: ['Trail Ridge Road is Closed to Through Travel for the Season']
description: ['Trail Ridge Road (U.S. Hwy 34) is closed to vehicles to through travel for the season. Trail Ridge Road is closed on the east side of the park at Rainbow Curve and on the west side of the park at Colorado River Trailhead.']

title: ['VA North OSV Closure']
description: ['The Virginia North OSV zone is closed due to road construction & will remain closed until construction is completed. For more information regarding this project please visit Beach Relocation and Habitat Restoration Projects | U.S. Fish & Wildlife Service']

title: ['Road Closure and Fishing Pier Impact']
description: ['The Engineer Wharf, one of two fishing piers at Fort Monroe is temporarily closed. The Finger Pier remains open. Also closed is the section of Fenwick Road between Ingalls and the East Gate of the fort. Detour signs will aid travelers around the closure.']

title: ['Vehicle Break-Ins']
description: ["Saguaro National Park is an urban park. Vehicle break-ins have occurred at trailheads around the park. Don't make yourself a target. Leave valuables at home, secure your vehicle, and report any suspicious activity."]

title: ['Seasonal closure of certain areas to prevent poaching']
description: ['The floodplain forest between the Connecticut River and NH Route 12A, north of the Blow-Me-Down Brook and forested areas on either side of Saint-Gaudens Road are closed to prevent damage from fiddlehead poaching during the months of April and May.']

title: ['South Unit Road from the Old East Entrance station mile near marker 22 to mile marker 28']
description: ['Due to major road repair work, the former scenic loop between the Old East Entrance Station (near mile marker 22) and mile marker 28 is closed to all traffic, including pedestrian, and bicycle access.']

title: ['Backcountry vehicle route closed for the season']
description: ['The backcountry vehicle route has closed for the season until May 15, 2025. As conditions allow, the route will be maintained as a groomed ski and snowshoe trail from the Cabin District to the horse barn near Cerro Piñon.']

park: Carl Sandburg Home National Historic Site
title: ['Main Parking Lot and Front Lake Trail Closed']
description: ["The Main Parking Lot, restrooms and front lake trail are closed due to impacts from Hurricane Helene. Access the Hiker's Parking Lot at 1924 Little River Road, limited to 24 spaces. Porta-toilets, trail maps, and park brochures available at this location."]

title: ['Starting April 15, ongoing road repair on Tuesdays and Wednesdays']
description: ['As of April 15, 2025, on Tuesdays & Wednesdays, road repair will be in effect . Please yield to construction traffic. Expect delays and uneven terrain. Bicycles and pedestrian traffic during this time is NOT recommended. Call visitor center with questions']

park: Paterson Great Falls National Historical Park
title: ['Overlook Parking Lot Unavailable After Dark']
description: ["The park parking lot at 72 McBride Extension is open from dawn to dusk every day. Any vehicles left in the parking lot after dusk (i.e. sunset) are subject to towing at owner's expense."]

title: ['Quarry Exhibit Hall Temporary Closure in Fall 2025']
description: ['The Quarry Exhibit Hall with the "Wall of Bones" will be temporarily closed from September 8, 2025, to late October 2025 for a major road, parking lot, and sidewalk reconstruction project. There will be no visitor access to the fossils in the building.']

title: ['Notice to travelers to National Cemetery']
description: ['Due to the narrow roadway & tight turn, RVs, mobile homes, charter buses, delivery trucks, or vehicles with trailers are prohibited from the crest of Monument Hill. Check for information about parking at the Visitor Center upon your arrival.']

title: ['Paces Mill Closed for Planned Rehabilitation Project']
description: ['Paces Mill will be closed until May 2025 with no access to parking, facilities, or the canoe launch. The last park boat ramp south of US-41 is open with limited, non-parking vehicle access for take-out. Plan to exit the river before Paces!']

title: ['Cabrillo Will Be Open From 1pm-5pm on Memorial Day, May 26, 2025']
description: ['Due to ceremonies at Fort Rosecrans National Cemetery on Memorial Day, May 26, 2025, the road to Cabrillo National Monument will be closed until 1pm. Cabrillo will be open from 1pm-5pm on Memorial Day.']

title: ['Fort Donelson NB Road Access on Spring Schedule Beginning Sunday March 9, 2025']
description: ['From March 9 through May 25, 2025, vehicles may access park roads from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm for the Spring season. Pedestrian Access remains from sunrise to sunset.']

park: Fort Union Trading Post National Historic Site
title: ['Fort Union Closed Through May 14 Due to Ongoing Investigation']
description: ['Fort Union remains closed 5/14/2025, as law enforcement continues its investigation following the safe arrest of a suspect. While surrounding roads have reopened, visitors are asked to avoid the area until further notice.']

title: ['Loose Gravel and Large Vehicles on Scenic Drive', 'Playground in Pine Grove Picnic Area Closed']
description: ['On a section of Scenic Drive near Cabin Camp 3 where a culvert under the road was replaced, there is compacted gravel across both lanes of travel. Use caution and follow posted speed limits. Be aware of constructions vehicles on the roadway.', 'The park is improving accessibility at the playground in Pine Grove Picnic Area. During construction, until approximately the end of June 2025, the playground is closed and 10 nearby parking spaces will be used for construction vehicles only.']

title: ['Pavement Preservation Project- Apollo District Begininng April 28th, 2025']
description: ['Apollo Beach District will begin a Federal Highways pavement preservation project on April 28th, 2025. Visitors to the seashore should expect limited access to some parking areas and roadways to include the Visitor Center and the boat ramp.']

title: ['Road Construction Highway US-26']
description: ['Road Construction Highway US-26 between Fort Laramie and Guernsey could impact travel time to Fort Laramie NHS.']

title: ['Expect long lines to enter the park']
description: ['Between March and November, particularly on busy holiday weekends, you may experience long lines at the entrance road. Parking lots at popular trailheads and viewpoints will fill early. Pack your patience and arrive early to avoid crowds.']

title: ['Highway 12 Detour until Spring of 2025']
description: ['The Minnechaduza Creek Bridge is currently closed for replacement. Traffic is detoured around the bridge using county road 906th. This impacts river visitors. Please contact Niobrara NSR staff for more information at 402-389-1925.']

title: ['Box Canyon Day Use Area Closed']
description: ['Due to the recent illegal lighting of a fire in the trash bin, the theft of government signs, and the unauthorized movement of barricades to drive into an area closed to vehicle traffic, the metal gate at the upper end of Box Canyon has now been closed.']

title: ['Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway continues with additional Parkway closures']
description: ['Beginning Tuesday, April 9, 2024, construction will close the Colonial Parkway to all travel in either direction between Yorktown and VA Route 199. Follow all detour signs. See additional closure information in the link below.']

title: ['Navigation']
description: ['Do not rely on GPS digital navigation systems to find your way to Badlands National Park. Please note that the Visitor Center at 25216 Ben Reifel Road, Interior SD 57750 is located just off I-90.']

title: ['Warning: HIGH VISITATION 3/1-5/26. Please Read ALERT in Full']
description: ['During High Visitation, Expect LONG LINES and LIMITED PARKING. RVS and Trailers should use overflow parking along road or unhitch before visiting. Busses should drop off passengers ONLY. Please pay online before visit and have passes/IDs ready.']

title: ['Vehicle Break-Ins: Take precautions to secure your vehicle and valuables.']
description: ["This is an urban park. Don't hide valuables inside your car. Carry items with you on hike. Lock your vehicle and set car alarm. Recent auto break-ins at Rinconada Canyon parking lot. Report suspicious persons loitering/peeking in cars. Call 928-638-7805"]

title: ['River Trail periodically closed under I-16']
description: ['The section of the River Trail beneath Interstate 16 is closed during bridge construction when pedestrian safety is at risk and remains open when no significant hazards are present.']

title: ['Portions of Stilesboro Rd. Closed Starting Tuesday, May 6th, 2025']
description: ["Beginning on Tuesday, May 6, Stilesboro Road will be closed from Gilbert Road to Old Mountain Road due to Cobb County utility work. The park's Visitor Center can still be accessed from Old Mountain Road and Old Highway 41."]

title: ['Jamestown Island Loop Roads Closed', 'Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway continues with additional Parkway closures']
description: ['Due to repairs taking place, The Jamestown Island Loop Drive is closed to all visitors, including pedestrians, cyclists, and vehicle traffic. The Island Loop Drive will reopen when it is safe to do so, likely in the Spring of 2025.', 'Beginning Tuesday, April 9, 2024, construction will close the Colonial Parkway to all travel in either direction between Yorktown and VA Route 199. Follow all detour signs. See additional closure information in the link below.']

title: ['Warning about GPS Systems!']
description: ['Vehicle Navigation Systems and GPS units may provide inaccurate information—sending drivers the wrong way on one-way roads, leading them to dead ends in remote areas, or sending them on roads which are impassable. Use the Interstate exits for wayfinding.']

title: ['Bugbee Road Closed']
description: ['Bugbee Road is closed due to road construction until mid or late May.']

title: ['Dangerous Highway Crossing']
description: ['Highway 177 is 60 mph with a blind spot directly across from the house. Safely use the highway underpass to the Fox Creek Trail just south of the visitor center parking lot. Be smart, stay alive.']

title: ['South Parking Lot of Greenbelt Park Closed to Vehicle Access']
description: ['This area will be closed to vehicle access from 12:00 a.m. May 9, 2025, and continuing until September 30, 2025, at 11:59 p.m. The area will remain available to pedestrians.']

park: Fort McHenry National Monument and Historic Shrine
title: ['Preservation Work Along Trails', 'Motorized Recreational Scooters Not Permitted in Park']
description: ['Starting March 18, preservationists restoring the bronze state plaques along the entrance road, and the War of 1812 commemorative markers in the Orpheus Grove. Some of these areas may be temporarily closed while work is in progress.', 'For the safety and protection of visitors and park resources, motorized scooters are not permitted within the park. Any vehicles (scooters, bicycles, etc.) that are part of a ride-share program may not be left behind for pick up inside the park']

title: ['Construction/Limited Access at Elk Creek Marina']
description: ['Starting Monday, May 5, the Elk Creek Marina will have both road and utility construction in order to repair a broken water main. Boat ramp and parking lot access will be limited. Construction will likely last 1.5 weeks.']

park: Chesapeake and Ohio Canal National Historical Park
title: ['Hiking in Gold Mine Tract']
description: ['Visitors are restricted to the designated trails within the Gold Mine Tract in the Great Falls area. This location is generally defined as that area bordered by MacArthur Boulevard and Berma Road and depicted on the Great Falls Maryland Hiking Map.']

title: ['Secure trash and food']
description: ['Pack it in, pack it out! There are no trash services in or around the monument. All food & trash must be secured inside a vehicle. Ravens routinely open zipped bags & tear into trash bags left outside or in the bed of a truck.']

title: ['Bringing a Pet to Big Bend?']
description: ['Bringing your pet to Big Bend National Park will limit some of your park explorations and opportunities. Pets are not allowed on park trails, in the backcountry, or on the river. Pets are allowed only where vehicles can go. Pets may not be left unattended']

park: Bent's Old Fort National Historic Site
title: ['A Short Walk is Required to Reach the Fort']
description: ["A 1/4 mile (1,275 feet) walk on a paved trail from the parking area is required to reach the gate of the fort. At the end of your visit, you'll return to your vehicle along the same path."]

title: ['May 17: Temporary closure on Park Road', 'Closure on Joyce Road NW for bridge replacement']
description: ['On May 17, from 6:30 am to 2 pm, Park Road will be closed between Beach Drive and Klingle Road NW for removal of hazardous trees and tree debris and cutting back of vegetation. A detour will be in place. Rain date for work/closure is May 18.', 'Joyce Road NW is closed from the entrance of Rock Creek Park Golf Course to Missouri Ave NW while the bridge over Luzon Branch is replaced. Detours will be in place during the closure period.']

park: Delaware Water Gap National Recreation Area
title: ['Possible Delays on Old Mine Road due to Van Campens bridge repairs', 'Dingmans Falls Trail, Visitor Center, and Access Roads Closed for Bridge Replacement - Summer 2025']
description: ['Due to a bridge repair project over the Van Campens Brook, visitors on Old Mine Road may encounter delays over Summer 2025. The road will remain open, with single-lane traffic during working hours.', 'Dingmans Falls site is closed for Summer 2025 for a bridge replacement project and trail rehabilitation. All traffic, including pedestrian, cyclist, and vehicle traffic, is prohibited on the road and trail during construction.']
relatedRoadEvents: [[{'title': 'Van Campens Brook Bridge Repair Project', 'id': 'ACAEB7BA-B148-4695-A7DC-F7D439937AFB', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/dewa/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'Dingmans Falls Road Bridge Replacement', 'id': 'DB8A7B66-6D23-4743-AF26-4A707375CECA', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/dewa/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]]

title: ['Passaic River Trail Bridge washed out']
description: ["Tropical Storm Ida washed out the Passaic River bridge on the Patriot's Path Trail south of Tempe Wick Road. This area is a known habitat of the endangered wood turtle, so do not wade, walk, or let your dog run in the river at this location."]

title: ['Downed Trees on Trails']
description: ['Please be cautions on all trails and side roads as high winds and heavy snow have caused several downed trees throughout the park.']

title: ['Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park']
description: ['You can prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots and scenic overlooks. Before leaving your car for even a short period of time: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.']

title: ['Trail Conditions']
description: ['Trail conditions can vary throughout the state. Before heading out, check the trail conditions, potential re-routes and closures on the Ice Age Trail Alliance website.']

title: ['NPS 300 Road Conditions']
description: ['NPS 300 to Big Tubes is dry and passable. A high clearance vehicle is recommended.']

title: ['State Route 20', 'Hozomeen Gate Remains Closed', 'Cascade River Road Seasonal Closure', 'Be Aware of Break-ins along State Route 20']
description: ['State Route 20 is open as of 4/22 but subject to closure by WSDOT on an as needed basis for incidents or emergencies. Before your visit, check the WSDOT real time map for up-to-date information on travel through the North Cascades.', 'Until further notice, the gate at Hozomeen will remain closed; vehicle and foot traffic across the US/Canada border is prohibited. Visitors must enter through a designated port of entry.', 'Cascade River Road is closed for the season at Eldorado (milepost 20). Check the road conditions page for more information.', 'Prevent smashed windows and theft. Break-ins are not uncommon at trailheads along State Route 20. Remove your valuables and electronics and take associated electronic cords.']

title: ['Trail update 1/24/2025']
description: ['Most trails are open and ready for the public. Those that remain closed are the Charleston Road/ Goudey Trail past the Cherokee Path and the portion of Cherokee Path between the stockade fort and the Charleston Road.']

title: ['Click on "view all alerts" below for important details on accessing the park', 'Pa-Hay-Okee Overlook Trail closed for replacement project until Fall 2025', 'Roadwork may cause delays on US 41/Tamiami Trail']
description: ['Construction on Tamiami Trail may cause minor delays. If you have a scheduled tour, please plan accordingly. Smoke impacts from park wildfires are possible along Main Park Road. Please use caution.', 'The Pa-Hay-Okee boardwalk trail, tower and parking lot will be closed for a replacement project until the fall. This is to replace aging infrastructure. The road remains open as a turnaround.', "Current roadwork is ongoing along the park's northern boundary on US Highway 41/Tamiami Trail to raise the road for Everglades Restoration benefits. Drivers may experience up to 15-minute delays and should watch for personnel, equipment and slow downs."]

park: Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park
title: ['South Rim Road construction continuing in 2025']
description: ['Road improvement projects will continue in 2025. Expect delays, alternating one-way traffic, and parking lot closures.']

title: ['Use Caution on Roads with Debris', 'Most Monument Roads Require Heavy Duty 4WD Vehicle to Travel Safely']
description: ['Flooding has resulted in debris along many roads within the park boundaries. Please use caution when driving on paved roads and watch for road crews at work. Be aware that unimproved and dirt roads may be impassible due to washouts, so plan accordingly.', 'Breaking down in the remote monument can be a life-threatening emergency. Most roads require a well-equipped, heavy-duty 4WD vehicle to travel. 2WD high clearance vehicles must use Walking Box Ranch Rd for entry and exit. No Visitor Facilities Available.']

park: New River Gorge National Park and Preserve
title: ['Cunard Road delays']
description: ['Cunard Road has been reopened. There is a section of one lane road with a traffic light. Through Memorial Day, expect delays of 3 to 5 minutes to get by this area.']

title: ['Preserve Pit Toilets - H.P. Williams']
description: ['Pit Toilets at H.P. Williams Roadside Park are CLOSED! Please continue to the Nathaniel P. Reed Visitor Center for the closest restroom. Other pit toilets may close in the near future, please be aware and use our Visitor Center Restrooms! Thank you!']

title: ['Use Caution with GPS Navigation']
description: ['The new visitor center is located at 17970 US Hwy 30, about one mile north of downtown Hagerman and the old visitor center. Highway signs and GPS navigation may not yet be up-to-date.']

title: ['Snow Plowing Operations along Lassen Park Highway', 'Portion of Lassen National Park Highway Closed']
description: ['Spring snow clearing operations are underway in Section 3 (Sulphur Works to Bumpass Hell). The road is open to pedestrian use; please use caution near plow ops. Stop and look before proceeding around plows; stay at least 100 feet from all equipment.', 'The main park road (Hwy 89) is closed at Sulphur Works (southwest entrance) and Devastated Area (northwest entrance) to vehicles. The road is open to pedestrian use beyond closures - watch out for snow, ice, and plowing operations.']
relatedRoadEvents: [[{'title': 'Snow Plowing Operations', 'id': 'F784272B-DA21-4606-8AF3-9382FD8E0203', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/lavo/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'Portion of Lassen National Park Highway Closed', 'id': '2347713F-D2F0-4DDF-92A4-E761B5F03FC1', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/lavo/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]]

park: Fort Sumter and Fort Moultrie National Historical Park
title: ['Fort Moultrie Fishing Dock Closure']
description: ['The Fort Moultrie Fishing Dock, Picnic Area, and Bench by the Road memorial are inaccessible until spring of 2026 due to a dock replacement project. An alternate picnic area along the sidewalk toward the General Moultrie Grave has been established.']

park: Sand Creek Massacre National Historic Site
title: ['8 Miles of Unpaved Road to Reach Park']
description: ['In order to reach the Sand Creek Massacre Site, visitors must travel on at least 8 miles of unpaved roads. We are not able to guarantee road conditions of county roads 54 or W after spring storms.']

title: ['Kelly Point and Twin Point Roadside Maintenance', 'Looking for a Grand Canyon view? A warning about mobile devices and map/navigation apps', 'Arizona Off-Highway Vehicle (OHV) Requirements for Residents and Non-residents.']
description: ['Roadside maintenance will begin the week of May 5th, 2025, and continue into the fall along Kelly and Twin Point Roads. These areas will remain open, though temporary pauses in traffic flow may be required for safety. Please use caution in all work zones.', 'Map apps may direct you to Parashant if you search for directions to "Grand Canyon" due the canyon\'s name in both the national park and monument names. The national park has paved roads and services. Parashant has no services and rugged/remote conditions.', 'Off-highway vehicles (OHVs) are required by law to display a valid OHV decal to operate on public and state trust lands in Arizona. This includes “street legal” vehicles that meet these two requirements.']

park: Great Sand Dunes National Park and Preserve
title: ['Medano Primitive Road Open between State Hwy 150 and 4th Creek Crossing']
description: ['The Medano Primitive Road is Open 6.4 miles from the pavement in the main park visitor area to the 4th creek crossing but CLOSED east of the crossing to the pass.']

title: ['County Line Road Closed Monday To Friday']
description: ['County Line Road is closed during the week, from Monday through Friday. The closure will apply to all vehicular, pedestrian, and bicycle traffic. Please find an alternate route.']

title: ['Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park']
description: ['You can help prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots. Before leaving your car to catch the ferry: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.']

title: ['Miles Creston Road Project to close May 28, 2025', 'Hawk Creek Lane Restriction at Lake Roosevelt National Recreation Area']
description: ['Miles Creston from Highway 2 to Copenhaver Road will close May 28, 20215 for several weeks to complete the paving project begun last year. Miles Creston is a main access to Lincoln Mill, Hawk Creek, and Seven Bays. Please use alternate routes.', 'Due to undercutting action of Hawk Creek on the access road between the Hawk Creek campground and boat launch, the road will be reduced to one lane until further notice. Use caution while on this road.']

title: ['Going-to-the-Sun Road Seasonal Closure', 'Many Glacier Construction Closure']
description: ['The alpine section of the Going-to-the-Sun Road is closed to vehicles. The road is open to Avalanche Creek on the west side and Jackson Glacier Overlook on the east side. Spring plowing is underway. Follow the link below for current hiker/biker closures.', 'Due to extremely limited parking during construction in the Swiftcurrent area, personal vehicle access into Many Glacier will be restricted from July 1-September 21, 2025. A temporary shuttle service will be provided for hikers wanting to access the area.']

title: ['Northwest Perimeter Road Open']
description: ['Northwest Perimeter Road is now accessible to visitors. Extensive cleanup and restoration efforts have been made following the EF 3 tornado that occurred on 4/27/2024. Please exercise good judgment and caution when driving or hiking through this area.']

title: ['SR165 Carbon River/Fairfax Bridge is closed: no access to Carbon River or Mowich Lake.', 'Paradise Road Status: Road opened, weather dependent.', 'Many park roads are closed for the winter season.']
description: ['There is NO public access to Carbon River & Mowich Lake from SR 165. The bridge is closed to pedestrians, bicycles and vehicles and there is no alternate route.', 'Regular nightly closure of the gate to Paradise at Longmire has ended for the season. The road can still close at any time due to weather/road conditions. All vehicles are still required to carry tire chains until May 1.', 'Many park roads are closed for the winter season, including White River, Sunrise, Stevens Canyon, Westside Road, and SR410/123.']
relatedRoadEvents: [[{'title': 'SR165 Carbon River/Fairfax Bridge Closed', 'id': '27D5FB15-B9FB-4556-B1A7-F320827F9B3E', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/mora/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [], [{'title': 'Closed for the Winter Season', 'id': '6E7D1A9C-253E-4183-9AAE-DED7F391C64B', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/mora/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]]

title: ['Scenic Drive Closed Beyond Grand Wash Road', 'Annual/Seasonal Canyon Closures']
description: ['The Scenic Drive is closed just south of Grand Wash Road. There is no access for vehicles, bicycles or pedestrians. The entirety of Scenic Drive is expected to close in mid-June. Expect heavy truck traffic and drive carefully through construction zones.', 'The following are closed to entry through 8/31/2025 to protect sensitive resources: Headquarters Canyon, the heads of Burro Wash & Fivemile Wash descending east 2 miles, Shinob Canyon + routes descending into Shinob, including Na-gah, Nighthawk, & Timpie.']

title: ['Parking Reservations Always Required - See "Know Before You Go" for Details', 'Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park']
description: ['Reservations are required for all personal vehicles and shuttle riders at Muir Woods. You can make your reservation by visiting www.gomuirwoods.com. Visit our "Know Before You Go" webpage to learn more important details before your visit.', 'You can prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots and scenic overlooks. Before leaving your car for even a short period of time: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.']

title: ['New Mexico Road Advisories']
description: ['The New Mexico Department of Transportation updates its map of road advisories regularly. Visitors are encouraged to look for any possible road advisories along their route of travel beforehand.']

title: ['Limited Parking at Salt Pond Visitor Center']
description: ['Due to paving work in and around Salt Pond Visitor Center in Eastham, parking is LIMITED. Paving work is expected to last through May, weather depending. Nauset Road milling work will begin Monday, April 28-30.']

title: ['N Shore Rd & S Shore Rd - 4/10/25']
description: ['Crews installed a bridge on N Shore Rd, restoring access to Graves Creek. The next N Shore Rd construction project may close a section of road July 9 - Sept 15, 2025. S Shore Rd - which is maintained by Jefferson County - washed out in a winter storm.']

title: ["Otto's Route Climbing Advisory"]
description: ["Due to confirmed May 2025 nesting activity on Independence Monument, the NPS has issued an advisory for Otto's Route through July 31. Please refrain from any rock climbing or off-trail activity within the vicinity of this route."]

title: ['Temporary Road Closures can Occur in Winter']
description: ['While the majority of park roads remain open, these three sometimes temporarily close to vehicles due to winter weather: Crystal Creek Road, Mill Creek Road, and Peltier Valley Road from Brandy Creek Road.']

title: ['Roosevelt Campobello International Park is located in Welshpool.']
description: ['Campobello Island is located in the province of New Brunswick, Canada. The physical address for the Visitor Centre is: 459 Route 774 Welshpool, New Brunswick, Canada E5E 1A4']

park: Chickamauga and Chattanooga National Military Park
title: ['Road Construction to Begin on a Section of Brotherton Road in Chickamauga Battlefield - May 5, 2025']
description: ["Construction is scheduled to begin on Monday, May 5, with the closure of Brotherton Road, between Alexander's Bridge and LaFayette Roads. During the closure, all public traffic is prohibited from using the closed section."]
relatedRoadEvents: [[{'title': 'Closure of a Section of Brotherton Road in Chickamauga Battlefield', 'id': '90E449E7-9264-4049-AE5D-6729F3C0E805', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/chch/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]]

title: ['Construction on State Highway ZZ, Farm Road 182 and other highways']
description: ['Be aware of ongoing construction on approach routes to the park. Roads may be closed for repaving, striping, and other reasons during spring, summer, and fall. Follow signs for detours.']

title: ['Rough and Damaged Roads']
description: ['Please drive slowly and exercise due caution when driving in Mojave National Preserve. Rough and damaged roads exist on both paved and unpaved roads. Watch for potholes.']

title: ['U.S. Navy Blue Angels Practices']
description: ['On Tuesdays and Wednesdays from April to October, parking lots at Fort Pickens Area fill early. Vehicles parked in non-designated spots are subject to citation and towing. When lots are full, the area will close to incoming traffic. Plan ahead.']

title: ['Vehicle Length & Trailer Restrictions']
description: ['No large vehicle turnaround after Faraway Ranch Parking Lot (1 mile after entrance). Vehicles over 29 feet park at Faraway. Disconnect trailers at Faraway. Trailers with campground reservations proceed directly to camp.']

park: Ulysses S. Grant National Historic Site
title: ['GPS Navigation Systems']
description: ["GPS navigation systems often misdirect visitors driving to Ulysses S. Grant National Historic Site. GPS systems often route visitors to our back gate, or to the entrance for Grant's Farm (not affiliated with the NPS). Please visit our directions page."]
